com.example.lab_net

Class MapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.lab_net.MapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class MapFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    MapFragment that loads up Google Map and generates and stores the device location, and displays it on the map. User can also click on interactive map to change their location to another point. Sends location coordinates continuously to MapActivity.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    gurjogsingh
    See Also:
    MapActivity, CoordinateListener

    • Method Detail

      • putLocationOnMap

        public void putLocationOnMap(android.location.Location lastKnownLocation,
                             com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Using lastKnownLocation generated by device and googleMap instance, location coordinates are plotted on map. Marker and title are added on coordinate as well. Location is updated in MainActivity.
        Parameters:
        lastKnownLocation -
        googleMap -

      • getLocation

        public void getLocation(com.google.android.gms.location.FusedLocationProviderClient fusedLocationProviderClient,
                        com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Gets the device location from the system and calls putLocationOnMap to plot the coordinates. Permission is suppressed here as the user can only reach here after giving permission in MapActivity, so asking for permission again is not needed.
        Parameters:
        fusedLocationProviderClient -
        googleMap -
